metadata.title: CVE-2021-47378 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:nvme-rdma: destroy cm id before destroy qp to avoid use after free Weshould always destroy cm_id before destroy qp to avoid to get cma eventafter qp was destroyed, which may lead to use after free. In RDMAconnection establishment error flow, don't destroy qp in cm eventhandler.Just report cm_error to upper level, qp will be destroy innvme_rdma_alloc_queue() after destroy cm id.
